nail somebody/something ↔ down.translati: to reach a final and definite agreement or decision about something
Two days isn’t enough time to nail down the details of an agreement.
to force someone to say clearly what they want or what they intend to do
Before they repair the car, nail them down to a price.
to force someone to say exactly what they want or what they intend to do
Before they repair the car, nail them down to a price.
to reach a final and definite decision about something
The US wants to nail down an agreement on anti-subsidy rules.
to make certain that you will get something
The prospect of a shortage has U.S. companies rushing to nail down long-term supplies of critical parts.
He sold the shares just because he thought it prudent to nail down a profit.
